comment.text: This translation key is used to display the label for a Microsoft sign-up button. It appears on the login form and is translated to support different languages, ensuring a consistent user experience across various regions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Bulgarian translation "Влезте чрез Microsoft" translates to "Log in with Microsoft" instead of "Sign up with Microsoft". While related, the meaning is different. "Sign up" implies creating a new account, while "Log in" implies accessing an existing one.

The translation 'Rekisteröidy Microsoftilla' is not the most natural or accurate Finnish translation of 'Sign up with Microsoft'. While technically understandable, it's a literal translation that doesn't flow well. A more natural phrasing would be 'Liity Microsoftilla' or 'Luo tili Microsoftilla'.

The translation "Գրանցվեք Microsoft-ով" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Sign up with Microsoft". While technically conveys the meaning, it's a bit clunky.  A more natural phrasing would be something like "Մուտքագրվեք Microsoft-ի միջոցով" or "Հաշիվ ստեղծեք Microsoft-ով".

The Lao translation "ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບດ້ວຍ Microsoft" translates to 'Log in with Microsoft' instead of 'Sign up with Microsoft'. While similar, 'sign up' implies creating a new account, while 'log in' implies accessing an existing one.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ສ້າງບັນຊີດ້ວຍ Microsoft

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Inscreva-se na Microsoft' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Sign up with Microsoft'. A more idiomatic translation would be 'Criar conta com Microsoft' or 'Registrar-se com Microsoft'.
The translation 'Cadastre-se com Linkedin' incorrectly translates 'Sign up with Microsoft'. It substitutes 'Microsoft' with 'Linkedin'.

The translation "Conectare prin Microsoft" is a literal translation of "Connect with Microsoft." The more natural and commonly used phrasing for "Sign up with Microsoft" in Romanian would be "Înscrie-te cu Microsoft" or "Creează cont cu Microsoft". "Conectare prin Microsoft" implies connecting an existing account, not creating a new one.
The translation 'Vpiši se z Microsoft' is a literal translation but doesn't flow naturally in Slovenian. A more idiomatic translation would be 'Prijavi se z Microsoft' or 'Ustvari račun z Microsoft'.

The translation "Региструј се путем Microsoft-а" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Sign up with Microsoft". While technically correct, it sounds somewhat clunky. A more common and fluent translation would be "Пријави се путем Microsoft-а" or "Региструј се са Microsoft-ом".
The translation 'Registruj se putem Microsoft-a' is not the most natural or idiomatic Serbian (Latin) translation of 'Sign up with Microsoft.' While technically correct, it sounds slightly awkward.
The phrase 'Microsoft-a' uses the genitive case, which is correct, but using 'uz' is more common and sounds more natural in this context.  The subtle difference affects readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: N/A - This is about stylistic preference, not a strict error.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '用 Microsoft 帐号注册' while understandable, is not the most natural or precise translation of "Sign up with Microsoft". It translates to "Register with a Microsoft account". A more accurate and commonly used translation would be '使用 Microsoft 账户注册' or '使用微软账号注册'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 使用 Microsoft 账户注册
